meanings.definition: A single lens for one eye.
meanings.sent1: She wore an eyeglass to help her see better up close.
meanings.sent2: He found his old eyeglass in a drawer and decided to use it.
meanings.sent3: The detective put on his eyeglass and examined the tiny clue.
meanings.sent4: Her eyeglass of wisdom revealed the truth hidden in the story.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling eyeglass made everything appear clearer and brighter.

meanings.definition: A pair of lenses set in a frame for wearing on the face.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's antique eyeglass had a delicate gold frame.
meanings.sent2: He bought a new eyeglass with a stylish black frame.
meanings.sent3: The comedian wore a funny oversized eyeglass during the show.
meanings.sent4: Her eyeglass of fashion made her look sophisticated and trendy.
meanings.sent5: The eyeglass perched on his nose gave him a scholarly appearance.

meanings.sent1: The gentleman adjusted his eyeglass to read the fine print.
meanings.sent2: She inherited her grandfather's antique eyeglass.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain's eyeglass made him look quite dashing.
meanings.sent4: His eyeglass of authority commanded respect among his crew.
meanings.sent5: The jeweled eyeglass gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
